20101231230230.000|20101231230232.000|TR0|winter weather, a suspected tornado carved 
20101231230232.000|20101231230235.000|TR0|its way across three counties in northwest 
20101231230235.000|20101231230237.000|TR0|Arkansas early this morning, leaving 
20101231230237.000|20101231230240.000|TR0|behind a deadly New Year's Eve disaster.  
20101231230240.000|20101231230242.000|TR0|The small town of Cincinnati, Arkansas, 
20101231230242.000|20101231230245.000|TR0|population 100, took the brunt of the 
20101231230245.000|20101231230247.000|TR0|blow, as these first shaky images reveal.

20101231230608.000|20101231230611.000|TR0|
20101231230611.000|20101231230613.000|TR0|CHAD MYERS, CNN METEOROLOGIST:  Yes.  They 
20101231230613.000|20101231230616.000|TR0|are headed to the east.  That's typical.  
20101231230616.000|20101231230618.000|TR0|And really, to the northeast.  That's the 
20101231230618.000|20101231230621.000|TR0|way the jet stream is pushing them right 
20101231230621.000|20101231230623.000|TR0|now.  There's a cold front in parts of the 
20101231230623.000|20101231230626.000|TR0|Midwest that's pushing cold air behind it. 
20101231230626.000|20101231230628.000|TR0| And all this red, that's all either all 
20101231230628.000|20101231230631.000|TR0|blizzard or winter storm warnings from 
20101231230631.000|20101231230633.000|TR0|Minnesota through parts of the Dakotas 
20101231230633.000|20101231230636.000|TR0|back into Nebraska, as well. The big 
20101231230636.000|20101231230638.000|TR0|weather was in the warm sector -- 65 
20101231230638.000|20101231230641.000|TR0|degrees in Atlanta.  It was 64 degrees in 
20101231230641.000|20101231230643.000|TR0|St. Louis before the weather moved through 
20101231230643.000|20101231230646.000|TR0|there. Now the temperatures are going 
20101231230646.000|20101231230648.000|TR0|down.  In fact, between Kansas City and 
20101231230648.000|20101231230651.000|TR0|St. Louis for a while, the temperature 
20101231230651.000|20101231230653.000|TR0|difference was 40 degrees -- 40 degrees 
20101231230653.000|20101231230656.000|TR0|colder in St. Louis.
20101231230656.000|20101231230658.000|TR0|
20101231230658.000|20101231230701.000|TR0|So let's get right to it, show you where 
20101231230701.000|20101231230703.000|TR0|it's going.  The biggest weather right now 
20101231230703.000|20101231230706.000|TR0|from Jackson, Mississippi, to Hattiesburg. 
20101231230706.000|20101231230709.000|TR0| Every one of the boxes, the red boxes, 
20101231230709.000|20101231230711.000|TR0|means that tornado watches are in effect, 
20101231230711.000|20101231230714.000|TR0|which means some storms may spin.  When 
20101231230714.000|20101231230716.000|TR0|you hear the word "warning," it means I'm 
20101231230716.000|20101231230719.000|TR0|warning you.  That's the next step up.  
20101231230719.000|20101231230721.000|TR0|That means a storm is spinning near you.

20101231231052.000|20101231231055.000|TR0|school -- this was 25 years ago -- 
20101231231055.000|20101231231057.000|TR0|Missouri really wasn't part of tornado 
20101231231057.000|20101231231100.000|TR0|alley.  It was kind of a hole in the 
20101231231100.000|20101231231102.000|TR0|middle of a donut.  But now it seems like 
20101231231102.000|20101231231105.000|TR0|your state is just getting it one storm 
20101231231105.000|20101231231107.000|TR0|after another.
20101231231107.000|20101231231110.000|TR0|
20101231231110.000|20101231231112.000|TR0|NIXON:  It really -- it does.  In the last 
20101231231112.000|20101231231115.000|TR0|few years, we've -- not only do we get 
20101231231115.000|20101231231117.000|TR0|tornadoes, I mean, we get ice storms.  We 
20101231231117.000|20101231231120.000|TR0|get floods.  And that's why our emergency 
20101231231120.000|20101231231122.000|TR0|management team is up and strong, and also 
20101231231122.000|20101231231125.000|TR0|our faith-based initiative.  I mean, many 
20101231231125.000|20101231231127.000|TR0|of these shelters, many of that sort of 
20101231231127.000|20101231231130.000|TR0|stuff is part of a significant initiative 
20101231231130.000|20101231231132.000|TR0|we've had to include members of the faith 
20101231231132.000|20101231231135.000|TR0|community to help us to provide the meals, 
20101231231135.000|20101231231137.000|TR0|to provide the other help.  And then our 
20101231231137.000|20101231231140.000|TR0|disaster folks are very good.
20101231231140.000|20101231231142.000|TR0|
20101231231142.000|20101231231145.000|TR0|So we'll be traveling tomorrow.  I'll 
20101231231145.000|20101231231147.000|TR0|personally be going to Sunset Hills, and

20101231231947.000|20101231231950.000|TR0|satisfaction.  This is a heavy travel 
20101231231950.000|20101231231952.000|TR0|weekend.  We're likely to hear some horror 
20101231231952.000|20101231231955.000|TR0|story from somewhere in the country about 
20101231231955.000|20101231231957.000|TR0|airport screening.  And that passenger 
20101231231957.000|20101231232000.000|TR0|discontent, combined with politics and 
20101231232000.000|20101231232002.000|TR0|business and security concerns, has 
20101231232002.000|20101231232005.000|TR0|reignited the debate.
20101231232005.000|20101231232007.000|TR0|
20101231232007.000|20101231232010.000|TR0|Should private companies screen airline 
20101231232010.000|20101231232012.000|TR0|passengers, rather than the Transportation 
20101231232012.000|20101231232015.000|TR0|Security Administration?
20101231232015.000|20101231232017.000|TR0|
20101231232017.000|20101231232020.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101231232020.000|20101231232022.000|TR0|
20101231232022.000|20101231232025.000|TR0|MESERVE (voice-over):  Put a 
20101231232025.000|20101231232027.000|TR0|Transportation Security officer next to a 
20101231232027.000|20101231232030.000|TR0|private screener, and you probably can't 
20101231232030.000|20101231232032.000|TR0|tell the difference. They wear almost 
20101231232032.000|20101231232035.000|TR0|identical, follow the same procedures and 
20101231232035.000|20101231232037.000|TR0|use the same technologies.  But an 
20101231232037.000|20101231232040.000|TR0|influential Republican member of Congress 
20101231232040.000|20101231232042.000|TR0|maintains private screeners provide better 
20101231232042.000|20101231232045.000|TR0|security.
20101231232045.000|20101231232047.000|TR0|
20101231232047.000|20101231232050.000|TR0|REP. JOHN MICA (R), FLORIDA:  We tested 
20101231232050.000|20101231232052.000|TR0|it, and I can tell you the results that 
20101231232052.000|20101231232055.000|TR0|came back convinced me and also others who 
20101231232055.000|20101231232057.000|TR0|independently analyze this that the 
20101231232057.000|20101231232100.000|TR0|private screeners can perform 
20101231232100.000|20101231232102.000|TR0|statistically significantly better -- not 
20101231232102.000|20101231232105.000|TR0|my words, their words.
20101231232105.000|20101231232108.000|TR0|
20101231232108.000|20101231232110.000|TR0|MESERVE:  But the Government 
20101231232110.000|20101231232113.000|TR0|Accountability Office says it did not 
20101231232113.000|20101231232115.000|TR0|notice any difference between the 
20101231232115.000|20101231232118.000|TR0|performance of private screeners and 
20101231232118.000|20101231232120.000|TR0|Transportation Security officers.  During 
20101231232120.000|20101231232123.000|TR0|covert checkpoint testing in 2007, both 
20101231232123.000|20101231232125.000|TR0|groups failed to find concealed bomb 
20101231232125.000|20101231232128.000|TR0|components.
20101231232128.000|20101231232130.000|TR0|
20101231232130.000|20101231232133.000|TR0|Though both TSA screeners and private 
20101231232133.000|20101231232135.000|TR0|screeners use the ever so controversial 
20101231232135.000|20101231232138.000|TR0|body imagers, Mica, the incoming chairman 
20101231232138.000|20101231232140.000|TR0|of the House Transportation Committee, 
20101231232140.000|20101231232143.000|TR0|seized the public uproar over the machines 
20101231232143.000|20101231232145.000|TR0|to push for privatization in a letter to 
20101231232145.000|20101231232148.000|TR0|airports around the country. The airport 
20101231232148.000|20101231232150.000|TR0|authority which runs Washington's two 
20101231232150.000|20101231232153.000|TR0|airports confirms it is looking at the 
20101231232153.000|20101231232155.000|TR0|issue, as requested by Congressman Mica.
20101231232155.000|20101231232158.000|TR0|
20101231232158.000|20101231232200.000|TR0|Private screening companies need TSA 
20101231232200.000|20101231232203.000|TR0|approval, have the follow TSA protocols 
20101231232203.000|20101231232205.000|TR0|and meet TSA standards.  And TSA claims it 
20101231232205.000|20101231232208.000|TR0|is neutral in this debate.  "If airports 
20101231232208.000|20101231232210.000|TR0|choose this route, we are going to work 
20101231232210.000|20101231232213.000|TR0|with them to do it," says a spokesman.  
20101231232213.000|20101231232215.000|TR0|Some independent analysts say there are 
20101231232215.000|20101231232218.000|TR0|some advantages to private screeners.  
20101231232218.000|20101231232220.000|TR0|They may be cheaper, more considerate of 
20101231232220.000|20101231232223.000|TR0|travelers and easier of fire.  But 
20101231232223.000|20101231232225.000|TR0|ultimately, they say, switching out 
20101231232225.000|20101231232228.000|TR0|government screeners for private ones is 
20101231232228.000|20101231232230.000|TR0|just tinkering around the edges.  They say 
20101231232230.000|20101231232233.000|TR0|what airport security really needs is a 
20101231232233.000|20101231232235.000|TR0|massive overhaul.
20101231232235.000|20101231232238.000|TR0|
20101231232238.000|20101231232240.000|TR0|ROBERT MANN, AVIATION CONSULTANT:  We 
20101231232240.000|20101231232243.000|TR0|really need to step back to square one and 
20101231232243.000|20101231232245.000|TR0|examine this from the beginning and 
20101231232245.000|20101231232248.000|TR0|perhaps totally replace the process.
20101231232248.000|20101231232250.000|TR0|
20101231232250.000|20101231232253.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
20101231232253.000|20101231232256.000|TR0|
20101231232256.000|20101231232258.000|TR0|MESERVE:  Airports have always had the 
20101231232258.000|20101231232301.000|TR0|option of using private companies to do 
20101231232301.000|20101231232303.000|TR0|screening, but out of more than 450 
20101231232303.000|20101231232306.000|TR0|airports in the country, only about 16 
20101231232306.000|20101231232308.000|TR0|have chosen to do so.  And we should point 
20101231232308.000|20101231232311.000|TR0|out that Covenant, one of the private 
20101231232311.000|20101231232313.000|TR0|companies that provides airport screening, 
20101231232313.000|20101231232316.000|TR0|is located in John Mica's congressional 
20101231232316.000|20101231232318.000|TR0|district.  Suzanne, back to you.
20101231232318.000|20101231232321.000|TR0|
20101231232321.000|20101231232323.000|TR0|SUZANNE MALVEAUX:  And Jeanne, is it 
20101231232323.000|20101231232326.000|TR0|clear-cut in terms of switching screeners 
20101231232326.000|20101231232328.000|TR0|whether or not this is going to help or 
20101231232328.000|20101231232331.000|TR0|hurt security?
20101231232331.000|20101231232333.000|TR0|
20101231232333.000|20101231232336.000|TR0|MESERVE:  It really isn't.  Separate and 
20101231232336.000|20101231232338.000|TR0|apart from the issue of how well the 
20101231232338.000|20101231232341.000|TR0|private screeners do versus the government 
20101231232341.000|20101231232343.000|TR0|screeners, there's a broader issue here.  
20101231232343.000|20101231232346.000|TR0|some people say that TSA was created to 
20101231232346.000|20101231232348.000|TR0|bring uniformity to standards across the 
20101231232348.000|20101231232351.000|TR0|country, and if you start having different 
20101231232351.000|20101231232353.000|TR0|people doing the screening, we may run the 
20101231232353.000|20101231232356.000|TR0|risk of having a patchwork system, where 
20101231232356.000|20101231232358.000|TR0|there would be gaps.  Other people say, 
20101231232358.000|20101231232401.000|TR0|however, Hey, listen, even the private 
20101231232401.000|20101231232403.000|TR0|companies have to abide by the same 
20101231232403.000|20101231232406.000|TR0|standards.  They're using the same 
20101231232406.000|20101231232408.000|TR0|technology.  Everything will remain more 
20101231232408.000|20101231232411.000|TR0|or less uniform across the country.  It is 
20101231232411.000|20101231232413.000|TR0|a debate right now.  There is not any 
20101231232413.000|20101231232416.000|TR0|decisive answer, Suzanne.

20101231233501.000|20101231233504.000|TR0|SUZETTE MALVEAUX:  Very interesting.  I 
20101231233504.000|20101231233506.000|TR0|have to say I agree with Chief Justice 
20101231233506.000|20101231233509.000|TR0|Roberts on - in terms of his emphasis on 
20101231233509.000|20101231233512.000|TR0|the importance of filling these judicial 
20101231233512.000|20101231233514.000|TR0|vacancies.  It is absolutely critical.  If 
20101231233514.000|20101231233517.000|TR0|you look at the number of cases that the 
20101231233517.000|20101231233519.000|TR0|Supreme Court considers, it is very few,
